title: Warframe Incarnon Weapon Tier List
description: This tier list ranks the Incarnon Weapons based on their performance in Steel Path, the game's most difficult content. It takes into account their damage, utility, and overall effectiveness.
heading: Warframe Incarnon Weapon Tier List
introText: This tier list ranks the Incarnon Weapons based on their performance in Steel Path, the game's most difficult content. It takes into account their damage, utility, and overall effectiveness. The list is updated regularly to reflect changes in the game's meta.

data.itemDescription: Built-in Viral and chaining projectiles make it a great choice for consistently high KPM
The best primary Incarnon for raw power; works as a crit-machine or energy-independent armor stripper
A top-tier Incarnon weapon with great single-target damage and chaining effects, though beam weapon skeptics may not rate it as SS tier
High Heat damage and strong critical stats make it a solid Incarnon pick
High Slash weight, great crit chance, and solid status—what the Soma Incarnon should have been
The original meta-defining Incarnon secondary
Insane single-shot burst damage, comparable to pre-nerf Catchmoon. Hemorrhage makes it great for Slash DoT scaling
A strong Latron rival but held back by inconsistent projectile homing. Shines with Zephyr’s Tornado build
Transforms from a classic single-target rifle into an AoE powerhouse with built-in Blast procs, excelling in Toxic Lash builds
Shoots a "goblet of fire" with high DPS but lacks ricochets. A status duplication glitch currently boosts its performance, but it remains A-tier even after fixes
A heavy hammer that excels in slam attacks and can be enhanced with Incarnon upgrades to significantly boost its area-of-effect damage
Lacks single-target DPS but is a solid upgrade for a beloved low-Mastery secondary
Powerful on its own, but no beam Incarnon can compete with Torid
Similar to Burston Incarnon, with lower fire rate but higher damage per shot
Like Nataruk on steroids, featuring high crit chance and a wide-radius projectile
Overlooked but decent sustained DPS with a high-status Riven; gains extra base crit chance via High Ground talent
Limited flamethrower range makes it subpar for mob farming but remains a meta damage source in level cap Disruption runs
Best dagger Incarnon, capable of 100 KPM with aim-glide attacks
Appears weaker than Hate but has 1.0 Follow Through in full melee mode, making it better at clearing groups
Competes with Dread and boasts the highest status chance of all bows
A semi-automatic rifle that transforms into a high-rate-of-fire automatic weapon with Slash and Radiation damage after landing multiple weak point hits
Once the strongest weapon due to a bug, now nerfed but remains a solid pick
Strong for an early-game weapon but not ideal for mobile playstyles; unique mechanics make it divisive

A pair of swift dual daggers with high attack speed and status chance, particularly effective in their Incarnon form, where kills generate spectral daggers that deal Cold damage and target nearby enemies
Best quick-shot revolver for single-target DPS, great for hunting Acolytes, Liches, Sisters, and Archons
Functions like Lex Incarnon with high AoE damage but is overshadowed due to Lex’s superior output and Riven disposition
Decent crit-status hybrid melee, but its weak spectral axe-throwing gimmick limits its potential
Outclassed by Hate unless you have a god-roll Riven
Good handling and damage but nothing exceptional; might improve with shield-break Crit talent
Strong throwing star but requires headshots for meaningful damage
Powerful but relies on a slow heavy-attack build, making it hover between A and B tier
Once a top shotgun for hunting Archons/Liches, but now has competition from newer weapons
Impact-to-Slash conversion isn’t great, but Furax Wraith is the best starter weapon with this upgrade
Good damage, but the delayed explosion gimmick feels clunky
A weaker version of Dual Toxocyst Incarnon, though Lato Prime offers better usability
Disappointingly underwhelming for something locked behind Zariman Faction standing
Works well with Lavos (B+ tier), but without him, Furax Wraith is the better Incarnon fist weapon
Inferior to Hate, which does forced Slash procs on heavy attacks more effectively
Cannot recapture its former glory, even at its best
Fun to use, but lacks the damage needed for Steel Path, even on the Prisma variant
Impact-to-Slash proc conversion applies to only one instance of Impact per strike
Weak single-target weapon, outclassed by all other single-target Incarnons
Expensive Cryotic sink with little payoff, even after Cold buffs in Jade Shadows
